_header: Many years been I-went / sithen truth out of land is lent
Note:
For the same Latin see 2006; and see Walther (1963)
XWalther, Hans. Proverbia sententiaque latinitatis medii aevi. 6 vols. Göttingen, 1963-69, no.15497; Walther (1969)
XWalther, Hans. Initia carmina ac versuum medii aevi posterioris latinorum. Göttingen, 1959; 2nd ed. 1969, no. 11396.
_description: Against flatterers, paraphrasing Latin verses: Multis annis iam transactis nulla fides in pactis — one quatrain to the right in John Grimestone’s sermon notebook

NLS18721.Transcription:
Manie ȝeres ben iwentSiþen treuthe outȝ of londe is
                    lentffaire wordis & wikke dedeBegilen man in al is nede
NLS18721.Editions:
Wilson,  Edward. 
             A Descriptive Index of the English Lyrics in John of Grimestone’s
                Preaching Book.
Medium Ævum Monographs
         n.s. 2. Oxford, 1973: 14.
